artist: André Albert Marie Dunoyer de Segonzac
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Charles S. Pillsbury, 1958
image_copyright: © Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York / ADAGP, Paris
provenance: Mrs. Charles S. Pillsbury, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 1958.
text: Early in his career, André Dunoyer de Segonzac exhibited oils with the now-legendary Cubists. But the independent Segonzac revealed his personal style more fully in his spontaneous etchings and watercolors. Many are rooted in the village of Saint-Tropez in southern France, where Segonzac bought a house overlooking the bay in 1925. Méditerranée is part of a series chronicling the beaches of the Côte d'Azur.
title: Méditerranée
